items.title: G.O.P. Senators Oppose Trump Watchdog Nominee After Report of Racist Texts
items.summary: At least four Republican senators, including the Senate majority leader, signaled their opposition to Paul Ingrassia, the president’s pick to lead the Office of Special Counsel.

items.title: Biden Completes a Course of Radiation Therapy for Prostate Cancer
items.summary: Former President Joseph R. Biden Jr. began radiation therapy last month for an aggressive form of prostate cancer. It is unclear if his treatment has ended.

items.title: Some States With Democratic Governors Are Posting Partisan Shutdown Messages on Official Websites
items.summary: The messages follow a pattern set by the Trump administration, but use notably milder language.

items.title: Illinois Officials Ask Supreme Court to Keep Block on Trump’s Chicago Troop Deployment
items.summary: A Supreme Court ruling, while technically temporary, could set the ground rules for National Guard deployments elsewhere in the country.

items.title: Congressional Democrats Investigate Arrests of Americans During Raids
items.summary: Representative Robert Garcia and Senator Richard Blumenthal started an inquiry to examine reports of misconduct by immigration agents, focusing on the arrests of citizens.

items.title: All but 2 Universities Decline a Trump Offer of Preferential Funding
items.summary: One of the two, Vanderbilt University, signaled it had reservations.

items.title: University of Arizona becomes seventh US college to reject Trump’s ‘compact’
items.summary: <p>Administration has pushed nine universities to sign a deal that seeks to make changes in line with conservative ideas </p><p>The University of Arizona has become the seventh US university to reject a Trump administration proposal that would grant schools funding priority if they agreed to support the administration’s conservative agenda.</p><p>The decision follows the administration’s push for nine universities to sign a “Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education,” which seeks to make sweeping changes to campus culture, hiring and admissions practices and foreign student enrollment. Demands from the Trump administration’s 10-point compact include reforms to the way race or ethnicity are used in admission and hiring practices, as well as a commitment to strict definitions of gender, among others.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/20/university-of-arizona-rejects-trump-compact">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Body of missing woman found buried behind abandoned Philadelphia school
items.summary: <p>Kada Scott was missing for two weeks before anonymous tip led police to wooded area with remains in shallow grave</p><p>Remains found buried in a wooded area behind an abandoned school are those of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman who had been missing for about two weeks, prosecutors in Philadelphia said on Monday.</p><p>Authorities said an anonymous tip led police back to the area they previously searched and they found the remains in a shallow grave. DNA tests confirmed her identity.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/20/philadelphia-missing-woman-body-kada-scott">Continue reading...</a>
